meanings.definition: To make a bogey on a golf hole.
meanings.sent1: He bogeyed the last hole during the golf game.
meanings.sent2: She bogeyed three holes in a row, but still enjoyed playing.
meanings.sent3: The golfer bogeyed the hole, but his friends cheered him on.
meanings.sent4: Despite his best efforts, he bogeyed the final hole, feeling disappointed.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the ball hitting the hole after he bogeyed echoed through the course.

meanings.definition: Past tense of bogey, meaning to have made a bogey on a golf hole.
meanings.sent1: Yesterday, he bogeyed the 18th hole and finished the game.
meanings.sent2: After she bogeyed the hole, she practiced more to improve her score.
meanings.sent3: His friends teased him good-naturedly after he bogeyed the hole.
meanings.sent4: The memory of how he bogeyed the hole haunted him during practice.
meanings.sent5: The crowd gasped as he bogeyed the hole, realizing he missed a chance to win.
